titleStmt.title: B. D. Lacy et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4614

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos E Bramblett
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners would respectfully represent that at the March Term of the Bath Circuit Court 1861 there was a Judgement rendered in behalf of the Commonwealth for twenty dollars against James Wells Jr. That James Wells Jr is now a private in Capt L. North's Camp of the 24th Regt Kentucky vol Infantry & on duty in the ranks at or near Knoxville Tenn That an execution has lately been issued on said Judgt and has been living on said James Wells property
Your petitioner would earnestly pray your Excellency to remit said fine

B D Lacy
George Coyle Sr
R. Coultshard
S C Bascom
John T Kimbraugh
Clement F Satterfield
James Brother
W. Y. Hunt
James Jones Sr
John Gillon
A. W. Bascum
Samuel McQurty
Elexander Wells
Francis McQuithy
Isaac Hopewell
James Cutt
B. Hurt
John Spencer
James M. Richards
Thos P Daugherty
G. S. Wegor
L. Goodpaster
Seaton Goodpaster
A S Wright
James Norris
Wm G Satterfield
Wm Rogers
John. W. Richards
Jno A Ramsey
James M Williamson
Edward Wells
Partick Tay
W A Daugherty
Philip Williams

Bath Cir Court
vs
Jas Wells Jr
$20-
15th Feby 1864

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
